intro: Hieracium farinodermum, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and basal leaves that are often lobed or toothed. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. Hieracium farinodermum is a perennial herb that thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
